Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Winkle \Win"kle\, n. [AS. wincle.] (Zo["o]l.) (a) Any periwinkle. --Holland. (b) Any one of various marine spiral gastropods, esp., in the United States, either of two species of {Fulgar} ({Fulgar canaliculata}, and {Fulgar carica}). [1913 Webster]
Note: These are large mollusks which often destroy large numbers of oysters by drilling their shells and sucking their blood. [1913 Webster]
{Sting winkle}, a European spinose marine shell ({Murex erinaceus}). See Illust. of {Murex}. [1913 Webster]

winkle n 1: small edible marine snail; steamed in wine or baked [syn: {periwinkle}] 2: edible marine gastropod [syn: {periwinkle}] v 1: emit or reflect light in a flickering manner; "Does a constellation twinkle more brightly than a single star?" [syn: {twinkle}, {scintillate}] 2: gleam or glow intermittently; "The lights were flashing" [syn: {flash}, {blink}, {wink}, {twinkle}] 3: remove or displace from a position [syn: {winkle out}]
